verses.verse: ((4 Against the governors of Jerusalem.8 Of the calling of all the Gentiles.13 A comfort to the residue of Israel.) ) Woe to her that is filthy and polluted, to the robbing (That is, Jerusalem.) city.
She heard not the voice: she received not correction: she trusted not in the Lord: she drew not near to her God.

Her princes within her are as roaring (Cross references: : Ezek. 22:2527; Mic. 3:11) lions: her judges are as (Hab. 1:8) wolves in the evening, which (They are so greedy that they eat up bones and all.) leave not the bones till the morrow.
Her prophets are light, and wicked persons: her priests have polluted the Sanctuary: they have wrested the Law.

The (The wicked thus boasted that God was ever among them, but the Prophet answereth that that cannot excuse their wickedness: for God will not bear with their sins: yet that he did patiently abide and sent his Prophets continually to call them to repentance, but he profited nothing.) just Lord is in the midst thereof: he will do none iniquity: every morning doth he bring his judgment to light, he faileth not: but the wicked will not learn to be ashamed.

I have (By the destruction of other nations he showeth that the Jews should have learned to fear God.) cut off the nations: their towers are desolate: I have made their streets waste, that none shall pass by, their cities are destroyed without man, and without inhabitant.

I said, surely thou wilt fear me: thou wilt receive instruction: so their dwelling should not be destroyed howsoever I visited them, but (They were most earnest and ready to do wickedly.) they rose early, and corrupted all their works.

Therefore (Seeing ye will not repent, you shall look for my vengeance as well as other nations.) wait ye upon me, saith the Lord, until the day that I rise up to the prey: for I am determined to gather the nations, and that I will assemble the kingdoms to pour upon them mine indignation, even all my fierce wrath: for all the earth shall be devoured with the fire of my jealousy.

Surely (Lest any should think then that Godâ€™s glory should have perished when Judah was destroyed, he showeth that he will publish his grace through all the world.) then will I turn to the people a pure language, that they may all call upon the name of the Lord to serve him (Hebrew, with one shoulder, as Hos. 6:9.) with one consent.

From beyond the rivers of Ethiopia, the (That is, the Jews shall come as well as the Gentiles: which is to be understood under the time of the Gospel.) daughter of my dispersed, praying unto me, shall bring me an offering.

In that day shalt thou not be ashamed for (For they shall have full remission of their sins, and the hypocrites which boasted of the Temple, which was also thy pride in times past, shall be taken from thee.) all thy works, wherein thou hast transgressed against me: for then will I take away out of the midst of thee them that rejoice of thy pride, and thou shalt no more be proud of mine holy mountain.
Then will I leave in the midst of thee an humble and poor people: and they shall trust in the Name of the Lord.
The remnant of Israel shall do none iniquity, nor speak lies: neither shall a deceitful tongue be found in their mouth: for they shall be fed and lie down, and none shall make them afraid.
Rejoice, O daughter Zion: be ye joyful, O Israel: be glad and rejoice with all thine heart, O daughter Jerusalem.

The Lord hath taken away thy (That is, the punishment for thy sin.) judgments: he hath cast out thine (As the Assyrians, Chaldeans, Egyptians and other nations.) enemy: the king of Israel, even the Lord is in the midst of (To defend thee as by thy sins thou hast put him away, and left thyself naked, as Exod. 32:25.) thee: thou shalt see no more evil.
In that day it shall be said to Jerusalem, Fear thou not, O Zion, let not thine hands be faint.

The Lord thy God in the midst of thee is mighty: he will save, he will rejoice over thee with joy: he will quiet himself in (Signifying, that God delighteth to show his love and great affection toward his Church.) his love: he will rejoice over thee with joy.

After a certain time will I gather the afflicted that were of thee, and them that bare the reproach for (That is, them that were had in hatred and reviled for the Church, and because of their religion.) it.

Behold, at that time I will bruise all that afflict thee, and I will (I will deliver the Church, which now is afflicted, as Mic. 4:6.) save her that halteth, and gather her that was cast out, and I will get them praise and fame in all the (As among the Assyrians and Chaldeans which did mock them and put them to shame.) lands of their shame.

At that time will I bring you again, and then will I gather you: for I will give you a name and a praise among all people of the earth, when I turn back your captivity before your eyes, saith the Lord.
